intro: Gastridium lendigerum subsp. scabrum, commonly known as the rough gastridium, is a flowering plant native to parts of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and hairy, rough-textured leaves. It typically grows in shaded, moist environments such as forest undergrowth. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest for taxonomists and botanists studying plant diversity.
